snippet: A review of Apple’s newest smartphone shows just how fast things are getting.

headline.main: Daily Report: The iPhone 7 Verdict Is In

snippet: Apple Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google engage in practices that undermine competition in the smartphone app market, Nikkei said, citing a report by Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry.

headline.main: Japan Report Shows Apple, Google Hinder App Competition: Nikkei
headline.print_headline: Japan Report Shows Apple, Google Hinder App Competition: Nikkei

snippet: A man who calls himself "Philly Jesus" has a new cross to bear: He's been found guilty of trespassing at a Philadelphia Apple store.

headline.main: 'Philly Jesus' Found Guilty of Trespassing at Apple Store
headline.print_headline: 'Philly Jesus' Found Guilty of Trespassing at Apple Store

snippet: Apple's stock hit a 2016 high on Wednesday, with its market value peaking above $600 billion (453.34 billion pounds) for the first time since April as Wall Street bet the technology company's newest iPhone would help shore up falling sales.

headline.main: iPhone Optimism Blasts Apple Stock to 2016 High
headline.print_headline: iPhone Optimism Blasts Apple Stock to 2016 High

snippet: The rules will put new pressure on American tech companies, but European officials say they will unite the Continent’s various national economies.
abstract: European Commission is set to announce new regulations that will bring Europe's economies into single digital market; proposal will force United States tech firms, which regard plans as protectionism, to comply with stringent competition, privacy and copyright rules.

headline.main: E.U. Rules Look to Unify Digital Market, but U.S. Sees Protectionism
headline.print_headline: Tech Firms See Protectionism in E.U. Plan to Unify Market

snippet: Wall Street edged lower on Wednesday as investors stewed about future interest rate hikes and cheaper oil dragged down energy shares, although Apple surged to its highest level this year.

headline.main: Fed Jitters and Oil Pull Wall Street Lower; Apple Rallies
headline.print_headline: Fed Jitters and Oil Pull Wall Street Lower; Apple Rallies

snippet: Twitter Inc launched a new video streaming application for Apple Inc and Amazon.com Inc TV platforms, as well as Microsoft Corp's Xbox One gaming console as it brings its video content to the forefront.

headline.main: Twitter Launches Video App for Apple and Amazon TV, Xbox One
headline.print_headline: Twitter Launches Video App for Apple and Amazon TV, Xbox One

snippet: A new Twitter app is coming to Xbox One, Apple TV and Amazon Fire TV, where viewers will be able to watch NFL games on Thursday nights.

headline.main: Twitter to Launch App on Apple TV, Others to Stream NFL
headline.print_headline: Twitter to Launch App on Apple TV, Others to Stream NFL

snippet: Asian stock markets were mostly lower Thursday following Wall Street's decline in light trading with exchanges in China and Korea closed for holidays.

headline.main: Asian Markets Lower After Wall Street Decline
headline.print_headline: Asian Markets Lower After Wall Street Decline

snippet: U.S. stocks surrendered early gains and finished mostly lower Wednesday as energy companies skidded with the price of oil. Apple led technology companies higher. The mixed finish came after three days of big, erratic moves.

headline.main: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Wednesday
headline.print_headline: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Wednesday
